alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Ector; Glasscock; Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:13PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL GLASSCOCK... ECTOR...SOUTHEASTERN ANDREWS...MIDLAND...SOUTHWESTERN MARTIN... NORTHEASTERN CRANE AND NORTHWESTERN UPTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM CDT... At 1012 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Midland International Air and Space Port, or near Odessa, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Additionally, blowing dust may reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Greenwood, Goldsmith, Midland International Air and Space Port, West Odessa, Cotton Flat, Warfield, Midland Airpark, Skywest Airport, Courtney, Odessa Schlemeyer Field, Spraberry, and Pleasant Farms. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 102 and 152. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for western Texas.
